Imports

Collection, CRUD, Transaction, private/libmdbx, private/utils

Types

Cursor = object of RootObj
  curs {...}{.requiresInit.}: ptr MDBX_cursor
  owner: Snapshot
  mdbKey, mdbVal: DataOut
  minKey, maxKey: seq[byte]
  minKeyCmp, maxKeyCmp: int
  positioned: bool

A read-only iterator over the keys/values of a Collection.

NOTE: Writeable Cursors are not implemented yet.

  Source   Edit

Consts

NoKey = 0
Use this to denote a missing end of a key range, e.g. ["a"..NoKey] or [NoKey.."z"].   Source   Edit

Procs

proc makeCursor(coll: Collection; snap: Snapshot): Cursor {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}

Creates a Cursor on a Collection in a Snapshot. The Cursor starts out at an undefined position and must be positioned before its key or value are accessed. Since the next function will move an unpositioned cursor to the first key, a typical way to iterate a collection by ascending key is:

    var curs = coll.makeCursor(snap)
    while curs.next():
        doSomethingWith(curs.key, curs.value)

  Source   Edit 
proc makeCursor(snap: CollectionSnapshot): Cursor {...}{.
    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError], tags: [].}
Creates a Cursor on a Collection in a Snapshot.   Source   Edit 
proc `[]`[T, U](snap: CollectionSnapshot; range: HSlice[T, U]): Cursor

Convenience to create a cursor by subscripting a CollectionSnapshot with a key range:

for (key,value) in cs["a" .. "z"]:
Use NoKey to denote no limit, so for 'everthing starting from "a"' use ["a" .. NoKey].

  Source   Edit 
proc close(curs: var Cursor) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Closes a Cursor, freeing its underlying resources. The Cursor may not be used again. (This happens automatically when a Cursor is destroyed, but you may want to do it earlier.)   Source   Edit

proc compareKey(curs: Cursor; withKey: Data): int {...}{.raises: [CatchableError],
    tags: [].}
Compares the Cursor's current key with the given value, according to the Collection's sort order. Returns 1 if the cursor's key is greater, 0 if equal, -1 if withKey is greater.   Source   Edit 
proc seek(curs: var Cursor; key: Data): bool {...}{.discardable, raises: [MDBXError],
    tags: [].}
Moves to the first key _greater than or equal to the given key; returns false if there is none.   Source   Edit 
proc seekExact(curs: var Cursor; key: Data): bool {...}{.discardable,
    raises: [MDBXError], tags: [].}
Moves to the _exact key given; returns false if it isn't found.   Source   Edit 
proc first(curs: var Cursor): bool {...}{.discardable,
                                     raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError],
                                     tags: [].}
Moves to the first key in range; returns false if there is none.   Source   Edit 
proc last(curs: var Cursor): bool {...}{.discardable,
                                    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError],
                                    tags: [].}
Moves to the last key in range; returns false if there is none.   Source   Edit 
proc next(curs: var Cursor): bool {...}{.discardable,
                                    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError],
                                    tags: [].}
Moves to the next key; returns false if there is none. If this is the first movement of this cursor (i.e. the cursor is not yet at a defined position), it moves to the first key, if there is one.   Source   Edit 
proc prev(curs: var Cursor): bool {...}{.discardable,
                                    raises: [MDBXError, CatchableError],
                                    tags: [].}
Moves to the previous key; returns false if there is none. If this is the first movement of this cursor (i.e. the cursor is not yet at a defined position), it moves to the last key, if there is one.   Source   Edit 
proc key(curs: var Cursor): lent DataOut {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the current key, if any.   Source   Edit 
proc value(curs: var Cursor): lent DataOut {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the current value, if any.   Source   Edit 
proc valueLen(curs: var Cursor): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the length of the current value, in bytes.   Source   Edit 
proc hasValue(curs: var Cursor): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns true if the Cursor is at a valid key & value (i.e. is not past the end.)   Source   Edit 
proc onFirst(curs: Cursor): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns true if the cursor is positioned at the first key of the collection.   Source   Edit 
proc onLast(curs: Cursor): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns true if the cursor is positioned at the last key of the collection.   Source   Edit 
proc valueCount(curs: Cursor): int {...}{.raises: [MDBXError], tags: [].}
Returns the number of values for the current key. (This is always 1 unless the Collection supports DuplicateKeys)   Source   Edit
